Links

Route: /links/<issue>
Parsing Links isn't always straightforward
Link Issue Description
FlaskTask.com/links/bad_uri The <base> tag allows the page to specify another url to use as the base of relative urls on the page, rather than the url of the page itself
FlaskTask.com/links/base The <canonical> tag specifies the canonical url for the page that's been visited
FlaskTask.com/links/canonical The schemes of links aren't limited to http, https, etc. -- they can be things like 'mailto', 'tel', etc.
FlaskTask.com/links/data_uri You can encode data (like images) into so-called data URI's and they can be quite large in practice.
FlaskTask.com/links/schemes We've sometimes found URIs that are kind of problematic. These examples come from the wild
FlaskTask.com/links/canonical_in_body Honor canonical, despite it in the body.
FlaskTask.com/links/multiple This page has multiple canonical links.
FlaskTask.com/links/malformed_href The space around this URL should be stripped.
FlaskTask.com/links/nofollow Href link that is tagged nofollow.
FlaskTask.com/links/relative_base Base URL is relative.
FlaskTask.com/links/long_label Label is too long, should be at most 63 characters.
FlaskTask.com/links/default_ports These links use the default ports for their schemes.
FlaskTask.com/links/internal This page has internal links.
FlaskTask.com/links/href_encoding This page has some invisible characters here, that keep the href from being normalized correctly.

Header Issues

Some issues with the headers
Link Issue Description
FlaskTask.com/headers/timeout_truncated A truncated response advertises a certain amount of data to be sent but then sends less than that. This example keeps the socket open, which doesn't allow the requester to know that the sender's done sending and this causes the request to time out
FlaskTask.com/headers/refresh Sets a refresh header
